titleStmt.title: The ordinance for tythes dismounted, from all Mosaicall, evangelicall, and true magesteriall right. By that valliant and most victorious champion, the great anti-clergy of our times, his superlative holyness, reverend young Martin Mar-Priest, sonne to old Martin the Metropolitane. Commended and presented to the petitioners of Hertford-shire, for their further encouragement, and for provocation of other counties to become petitionary with them against the unhallowed illegall exaction of tythes.
titleStmt.author: Overton, Richard, fl. 1646.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Martin Claw-Clergy printer to the Reverend Assembly of Divines, for Bartholomew Bang-Priest, and are to be sold at his shop in Toleration-street, at the signe of the Subjects Liberty, right opposite to Persecution-Court,

notesStmt.note: Thomason received his copy December 29, 1645; Wing has 1646.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb: 29 1645"; the second 6 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Toleration-street, at the signe of the Subjects Liberty, right opposite to Persecution-Court
